--- John Smith <haefeleuser@...> wrote:
> --- Shane Mingins <shanemingins@...> wrote:
> > 
> > 10x?  It's about $100 in the shops here ;-)  
> > 
> > It's moving close to the top of my list though.
> > 
> > Cheers
> > Shane
> 
> It covers a lot of recipes on 700 pages.

I am guessing that when I finally get a copy (and it
is pretty certain that I will) that it will be my
favourite JUnit book. 

> 
> You
> probably
> don't speak German, but I want to suggest two good
> books about JUnit for the German readers of this
> forum: "Softwaretests mit JUnit" by Johannes Link
> and
> the not yet released "Testgetriebene Entwicklung mit
> JUnit und FIT" by Frank Westphal.

No I don't speak German.  Is that last book a book on
Ward Cunningham's FIT?  I am so looking forward to
Rick and Ward's FIT booking due out next month.  And
Rick is a fellow kiwi!

> 
> To become a master of JUnit it takes years of
> practice, although it is easy to learn the basics.

Like most things.  I always remember the phrase on my
Othello game  ... "a moment to learn a lifetime to
master"

Cheers
Shane
